title.narrative: Providing Lifesaving Reproductive Health and GBV Response Services for IDPs affected by escalating Crisis in Ma’rib

description.narrative:
The CERF project supports the improvement of access to lifesaving reproductive health services through support to the delivery of the Minimum Initial Service Package (MISP) for reproductive health. In particular, the project provides direct support to 12 health facilities (6 CEmONC - Comprehensive Emergency Obstetric and Newborn Care and 6 BEmONC - Basic Comprehensive Obstetric and Newborn Care) that are serving the recently displaced IDPs in Marib, Al Jawf and Hadramawt. The project provides payment of incentives to retain health workers and provide other operational costs critical for the provision of the MISP for reproductive health and comprehensive reproductive health care as the situation allows. In parallel, the response to, and prevention of GBV will be addressed through provision of MHPSS, legal aid, livelihood and vocational services, and delivery of protection kits in women and girls’ safe spaces that aim to restore a sense of safety and human dignity through group and individual services and create a safe environment and opportunity for identification of women and girls at risk from GBV.
The project targets 50,148 affected people through its Health/SRH engagement and 45,000 affected people through its Protection/GBV engagement.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Available and accessible GBV lifesaving and services targeting the specific needs of women and girls at risk
Cash.2a Number of people receiving sector-specific unconditional cash transfers
Cash.2b Total value of sector-specific unconditional cash transfers distributed in USD
PS.1a Number of people benefitting from safe spaces and/or centres
PS.1b Number of safe spaces and/or centres rehabilitated
PS.2 Number of people benefitting from core GBV services (e.g. case management, psycho-social support, clinical management of rape, PEP, etc.)
Improved availability of emergency obstetric and new-born care, family planning and other lifesaving reproductive health services for communities affected by the escalation of fighting in Marib
H.7 Number of functional health facilities supported (to provide Reproductive Health services)
H.8 Number of primary healthcare consultations provided (Number of other reproductive healthcare consultations provided in the supported health facilities)
RH.1 Number of live births assisted by a skilled health personnel (in the supported health facilities)
